name: A simple sketch for Jeopardy!
tagline: A Simple sketch for an Arduino compatible Teensy 3.0 as an input device for a Jeopardy! game: 4 buttons, 4 LEDs and USB HID.
body:
### Jeopardy
If you don't know the Jeopardy game, go look it up at Wikipedia: [Jeopardy!](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeopardy!)

### Display and game logic
To display the game, count points and all the cumbersome stuff Christian Lange's @chlange[/jeopardy](https://github.com/chlange/jeopardy) was used.

### Hardware
#### Breadboard
This is how the whole circuit looks like on a breadboard:
![circuit on a breadboard](http://gflorian.github.io/simple-jeopardy-sketch/images/breadboard_complete.jpg)

#### Controller
The four controllers were made of wood (actually parts of a broomstick) and a pushbutton with a LED:
![top part of one controller (green)](http://gflorian.github.io/simple-jeopardy-sketch/images/controller_top_explode.jpg)

### Code
Just download it from here ([.zip](https://github.com/gflorian/simple-jeopardy-sketch/zipball/master) or [.tar.gz](https://github.com/gflorian/simple-jeopardy-sketch/tarball/master)) or go to the [github page](https://github.com/gflorian/simple-jeopardy-sketch).
